intro: Teline benehoavensis, commonly known as the Benhoavensis grass, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Madagascar. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spikelet-based flowers that are typically green or pale in color. Teline benehoavensis is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and unique ecological role, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
